column2: Table 1: The percentage of residents  living in 'Not Good' health by bedroom occupancy in England and Wales, 2011 1,2,3,4

column4: Under-occupied: Two or more spare bedrooms
column6: Standard Occupancy: The recommended amount of bedrooms
column7: Overcrowded: At least one bedroom less than needed

column2: 2. A bedroom occupancy rating was derived for each household in England and Wales by subtracting the ‘bedroom standard’ (recommended in the Housing (Overcrowding) Bill of 2003) from the number of bedrooms actually available in the house
4. Residents who indicated that their general health was ‘Fair’, ‘Bad’, or ‘Very bad’ in the 2011 Census were classified as having ‘Not Good’ health
